text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company

-- IRA BOMBING BRITAIN AGAIN Two bombs exploded in the commuter town of Wilmslow, Cheshire, this morning, one at the town's railway station and one at its police station. Doncaster Police have confirmed that an IRA threat was received.
-- GILTS AUCTION SET TO TEST NEW RATE MOOD Following last night's rise in US interest rates, a 2.5bn stg auction of British gilt-edged stock today should test the mood of investors.

-- LONRHO-ANGLO AMERICAN TALK ASSETS SWAP Lonrho is in talks with Anglo-American Corporation of South Africa for a swap of 33 percent of its stake in Ghana-based Ashanti Goldfields for at least part of Anglo-American's 26 percent holding in Lonrho.

-- SCOTS MOVE POINTS WAY AHEAD FOR LLOYD'S NAMES A scheme to turn 550 Lloyd's Names into limited liability investors has been launched by members' agent Anton Jardine. The scheme will be offered to Names at other members' agencies, and will require authorisation from the Investment Management Regulatory Organisation.
-- NORWICH NUMBERS PROBLEM Soon-to-float insurance company Norwich Union is being flooded with telephone calls from policy holders anxious to know how their allocation of shares has been calculated.
